title: "No Comment": India On Bangladesh Seeking Sheikh Hasina's Extradition - NDTV
summary:
India Responds to Bangladesh's Request for Sheikh Hasina's Extradition

Date: August 6, 2024

Source: NDTV

India has received a note verbale from Bangladesh regarding an extradition request for Sheikh Hasina, the ousted Prime Minister of Bangladesh, amid her controversial political situation.

  • Bangladesh seeks Sheikh Hasina's extradition to face trial in her home country.
  • The note verbale was confirmed by Indian authorities, who stated they would not comment on the matter.
  • Bangladesh's Foreign Minister indicated that Hasina is wanted for judicial proceedings related to her time in office.
  • Sheikh Hasina left Bangladesh on August 5 after protests led to her ousting.
  • Arrest warrants have been issued for Hasina and other officials by the International Crimes Tribunal for alleged crimes against humanity.
"We have sent a note verbale to the Indian government saying that Bangladesh wants her back here for the judicial process." - Touhid Hossain, Bangladesh's Foreign Minister

The situation remains tense as discussions between India and Bangladesh unfold, with legal and diplomatic implications for the region.
newTitle: India Responds to Bangladesh's Request for Sheikh Hasina's Extradition

title: PM Modi Attends Christmas Programme Hosted By Catholic Bishops Conference Of India - News18
summary:
PM Modi Condemns Violence and Emphasizes Harmony at Christmas Celebration

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 Source: News18

During a Christmas event hosted by the Catholic Bishops’ Conference of India, PM Modi condemned attempts to incite violence and called for a spirit of love and harmony as taught by Jesus Christ.

  • PM Modi addressed the CBCI Christmas event in New Delhi, condemning societal violence.
  • He highlighted the importance of Jesus's teachings on love, brotherhood, and compassion.
  • Condemned the recent terror attack in Germany that resulted in multiple casualties.
  • Promised to prioritize human interests alongside national interests in foreign policy.
  • Expressed pride in the elevation of George Koovakad as a Cardinal.
  • Invited Pope Francis to visit India during his speech.
“The Bible says – bear each other’s burdens. Our institutions and organisations work with this motto,” PM Modi stated.

PM Modi's speech emphasized the need for unity and compassion while reflecting on India's responsibilities on the global stage.
newTitle: PM Modi Condemns Violence and Emphasizes Harmony at Christmas Celebration

title: Wife Imposing Her Friends & Family At Husband's Residence Against His Will Amounts To Cruelty: Calcutta... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Calcutta High Court Rules Against Wife for Imposing Guests on Husband

Date: 2024-01-15 | Source: Live Law

The Calcutta High Court has ruled that a wife imposing her friends and family on her husband at his residence without his consent amounts to cruelty.

“Such imposition of friend and family of the respondent on the husband at his quarter against his will… can definitely be constituted as cruelty…”
  • The appellant-husband filed for divorce citing cruelty due to the wife's actions.
  • The court noted that the wife's behavior made life unbearable for the husband.
  • There were disputes regarding the wife's alleged false accusations against the husband.
  • The bench emphasized that the unique circumstances of the couple's case must be considered.
  • The appeal by the husband was granted, resulting in a divorce decree.

Case: Mr. Dhiraj Guin Vs. Mrs. Tanusree Majumder | Case No: F.A. No. 1 of 2022 | Citation: 2024 LiveLaw (Cal) 283
newTitle: Calcutta High Court Rules Against Wife for Imposing Guests on Husband

title: Not just IAF, defence ministry undertakes critical review of tri-service priorities & solutions - ThePrint
summary:
Defence Ministry Reviews Priorities with Armed Services

Publication Date: New Delhi
Source: ThePrint

The Ministry of Defence is conducting an extensive internal review with the armed services to assess procurement priorities for the next 8-10 years and address existing roadblocks.

  • The Defence Secretary initiated this process following discussions at the IAF Commanders’ Conference.
  • A collaborative effort aims to compile a comprehensive list of priorities, problems, and potential solutions.
  • The IAF is facing critical shortages in fighter strength and related resources.
  • Procurement plans have been stalled for key aircraft like the Multi-Role Fighter Aircraft (MRFA) and have seen delays in the delivery of Tejas MK 1A.
  • The Defence Secretary is in contact with all three armed services to expedite this review.
“Time is for solutions. Identify the problems and also come with solutions,” said a source involved in the process.

The Defence Ministry's proactive review seeks to ensure timely and effective acquisitions to enhance the capabilities of the armed forces.
newTitle: Defence Ministry Reviews Priorities with Armed Services

title: Jaishankar to visit US from December 24-29, first since Donald Trump's election victory - Hindustan Times
summary:
Jaishankar to visit US from December 24-29, first since Donald Trump's election victory

Date: December 23, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

External Affairs Minister Subrahmanyam Jaishankar will be on a six-day visit to the United States starting December 24, 2024. This trip marks the first high-level visit from India to the US following Donald Trump's presidential election win, focusing on key bilateral, regional, and global discussions.

  • External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar will visit the US from December 24-29, 2024.
  • The visit aims to discuss important bilateral ties and regional issues.
  • Jaishankar will chair a conference of Indian Consul Generals during his stay.
  • This is the first visit to the US after Trump’s election, signaling potential shifts in US-India relations.
Jaishankar stated the US would “become more self-aware under the Donald Trump administration regarding its economic and manufacturing interests.”

The visit is significant for enhancing discussions on trade, tariffs, and collaborative efforts between India and the US, as highlighted by US Ambassador Eric Garcetti.
newTitle: Jaishankar to Visit the US: First Official Visit Since Trump's Victory

title: Assam Police SI Admit Card 2024 Live: SLPRB admit card released at slprbassam.in, direct link - Hindustan Times
New GST rates on popcorn spark backlash on social media - The Times of India
summary:
New GST Rates on Popcorn Spark Backlash on Social Media

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Times of India

The recent implementation of new GST rates on popcorn has triggered significant backlash on social media platforms, with many users expressing their discontent.

  • The new GST on popcorn is seen as excessive by the public.
  • Social media users are using hashtags to voice their frustration.
  • Many argue that popcorn is a staple snack in cinemas and should not be heavily taxed.
“Popcorn should not be taxed like luxury items,” stated a moviegoer.

This situation highlights public sensitivity to tax policies, especially concerning everyday goods and leisure activities.
newTitle: New GST Rates on Popcorn Spark Backlash on Social Media

title: Former Supreme Court Justice V Ramasubramanian appointed NHRC Chairperson - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Former Supreme Court Justice V Ramasubramanian appointed NHRC Chairperson

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

The appointment has been made consequent upon the retirement of Justice Arun Mishra from the post on June 1. NHRC member Vijayabharathi Sayani was serving as the acting chairperson in the interregnum.

Key Points:

  • Justice Ramasubramanian completed his law degree from Madras Law College.
  • He was appointed as an additional judge of the Madras High Court in 2006.
  • He served as Chief Justice of Himachal Pradesh High Court before his Supreme Court appointment.
  • He demitted office from the Supreme Court on June 29, 2023.
“Justice Ramasubramanian’s appointment marks a significant transition for the NHRC.”

This appointment signifies a continuation of experienced leadership within the NHRC following a notable retirement.
newTitle: Former Supreme Court Justice V Ramasubramanian appointed NHRC Chairperson

title: Former Supreme Court judge V. Ramasubramanian appointed NHRC chairman - The Hindu
summary:
Justice V. Ramasubramanian appointed as NHRC Chairman

Publication Date: December 23, 2024 Source: The Hindu

President Droupadi Murmu has appointed retired Supreme Court Judge Justice V. Ramasubramanian as the Chairman of the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) from Tamil Nadu.

  • Justice Ramasubramanian was appointed on December 23, 2024.
  • He was a judge of the Supreme Court of India from September 2019.
  • The NHRC chairpost has been vacant since Justice Arun Kumar Mishra's term ended on June 1, 2024.
  • A high-power committee led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi selected him for the position.
  • Prior to this, he served as Chief Justice of Himachal Pradesh High Court.
"The post of NHRC chairperson has been lying vacant since Justice (retired) Arun Kumar Mishra completed his tenure on June 1."

This appointment brings a highly experienced and scholarly individual to lead the NHRC, which has been missing leadership for several months.
newTitle: Justice V. Ramasubramanian appointed as NHRC Chairman

title: Ex-Supreme Court judge V Ramasubramanian appointed NHRC chief - The Times of India
summary:
Ex-Supreme Court Judge V Ramasubramanian Appointed NHRC Chief

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Former Supreme Court Justice V Ramasubramanian has been appointed as the Chief of the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC).

  • V Ramasubramanian served as a judge in the Supreme Court from 2019 until his retirement.
  • The appointment comes as part of governmental efforts to enhance the functioning of the NHRC.
  • The NHRC is responsible for promoting and protecting human rights in the country.
  • This appointment is seen as a significant step in the NHRC's ongoing initiatives.
“Justice Ramasubramanian brings a wealth of experience to the position,” commented a government spokesperson.

The appointment is expected to strengthen the NHRC as it addresses various human rights issues across India.
newTitle: Ex-Supreme Court Judge V Ramasubramanian Appointed NHRC Chief

title: Jaishankar to begin 6-day visit to US from December 24 - The Times of India
summary:
Jaishankar to Begin 6-Day Visit to the US from December 24

Publication Date: December 2023

Source: Times of India

India's External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar is set to embark on a six-day visit to the United States starting December 24, 2023. The visit will focus on strengthening bilateral ties and addressing key geopolitical issues.

  • Jaishankar's itinerary includes meetings with top US officials.
  • The discussions are expected to cover trade, defense, and climate change.
  • This visit marks a continuation of India's active diplomatic engagement with the US.
“This visit is crucial for furthering India-US relations in a rapidly changing global landscape.”

The upcoming visit underscores the importance of India and the US as partners in addressing global challenges.
newTitle: Jaishankar to Begin 6-Day Visit to the US from December 24

title: Send Sheikh Hasina back: Bangladesh's latest note to India - Hindustan Times
Centre scraps ‘no-detention policy’ for classes 5 and 8 students - The Hindu
summary:
Centre scraps ‘no-detention policy’ for classes 5 and 8 students

Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

The Centre has announced the removal of the 'no-detention policy' for classes five and eight in schools under its jurisdiction, allowing failure for students who do not pass year-end exams. This change follows amendments to the Right to Education Act (RTE) made in 2019.

  • At least 16 States and 2 Union Territories have already abandoned the 'no-detention policy'.
  • Children who fail will receive remedial instruction and an opportunity for re-examination within two months.
  • If the re-examination is unsuccessful, the child will be held back in their current class.
  • No child will be expelled from school until completing elementary education.
  • The notification affects over 3,000 central government schools.
“During the holding back of the child, the class teacher shall guide the child as well as the parents of the child, if necessary, and provide specialised inputs after identifying the learning gaps.”

This policy marks a significant shift in educational practice aimed at accountability in foundational years.
newTitle: Centre scraps ‘no-detention policy’ for classes 5 and 8 students

title: Centre scraps no-detention policy for classes 5 and 8 students who fail to clear year-end exams - Greater Kashmir
RSMSSB Group D Online Form 2025 (52,453 Post) - SarkariExam.com
Sheikh Hasina extradition: Bangladesh sends note verbale asking India to send back deposed PM - The Hindu
summary:
Bangladesh Requests Extradition of Deposed PM Sheikh Hasina from India

Published: December 23, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Bangladesh's interim government has requested the extradition of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina from India, where she has been living in exile since fleeing the country amid protests.

  • Sheikh Hasina fled to India on August 5, 2024, amid student-led protests that deposed her.
  • Bangladesh's International Crimes Tribunal has issued arrest warrants against Hasina for crimes against humanity.
  • The interim government has sent a diplomatic note to India requesting her return for judicial proceedings.
  • An existing extradition treaty between Bangladesh and India could facilitate the process.
“Bangladesh wants her back here for the judicial process,” Foreign Affairs Adviser Touhid Hossain said.

In conclusion, Bangladesh is actively pursuing the legal return of Sheikh Hasina to face serious charges stemming from her time in office.
newTitle: Bangladesh Requests Extradition of Deposed PM Sheikh Hasina from India

title: NLU Consortium challenges Delhi High Court directive to revise CLAT 2025 result - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
Rahul Gandhi claims Parbhani violence victim killed ‘because he was a Dalit’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Rahul Gandhi Claims Parbhani Violence Victim Killed ‘Because He Was a Dalit’

Date: December 23, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Rahul Gandhi met the family of Somnath Suryawanshi, who allegedly died in judicial custody after violence in Parbhani, Maharashtra earlier this month. He claimed Suryawanshi was killed due to his status as a Dalit and his fight to protect the Constitution.

  • Gandhi stated that Suryawanshi’s death was a “100 per cent custodial death”.
  • The violence in Parbhani was triggered by vandalism of a Constitution replica near Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar's statue.
  • CM Devendra Fadnavis claimed that CCTV footage showed no evidence of violence against Suryawanshi.
  • Fadnavis ordered a judicial probe into the incident.
“No politics is being done... The ideology is responsible.” - Rahul Gandhi

The incident highlights ongoing tensions related to caste and justice in India, drawing significant public and political attention.
newTitle: Rahul Gandhi Claims Parbhani Violence Victim Killed ‘Because He Was a Dalit’

title: Bengaluru Techie Loses Rs 11.8 Crore After "Digital Arrest" - NDTV
summary:
Bengaluru Techie Loses ₹11.8 Crore After 'Digital Arrest'

Date: Published by NDTV

A 39-year-old software engineer lost ₹ 11.8 crore in a scam where fraudsters impersonated police officials, claiming his Aadhaar card was misused for money laundering.

  • The scam occurred between November 25 and December 12.
  • The victim received a call from a fraudster posing as a TRAI officer about illegal activities linked to his SIM card.
  • Fraudsters claimed his Aadhaar details were used for money laundering, threatening him with arrest.
  • The victim was coerced into transferring funds under the guise of a verification process.
  • He eventually realized it was a scam when further demands for money were made.
“Citing a fake Reserve Bank of India (RBI) guidelines, the fraudsters allegedly asked him to transfer funds... or face legal consequences.”

A case has been registered under the IT Act for cheating and impersonation, with an ongoing investigation by the police.
newTitle: Bengaluru Techie Loses ₹11.8 Crore to Digital Arrest Scam

title: Bengaluru sees 0.59% rise in forest cover, ranks among India’s greenest metros: Report - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bengaluru sees 0.59% rise in forest cover, ranks among India’s greenest metros: Report

Date: Dec 23, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

This article discusses Bengaluru's recent increase in forest cover, which has positioned it among India’s greenest metropolitan areas.

  • Bengaluru's forest cover rose by 0.59% from 2021.
  • The total forest cover now spans 89.61 square kilometers.
  • The city ranks second in urban forest expansion, with a growth of 2.09 km².
  • Chennai and Hyderabad reported reductions in their forest cover.
  • Bengaluru experienced 51 forest fire incidents in 2023-24, up from 44 the previous year.
“No matter how influential the encroachers may be, stern action must be taken.” - Karnataka Forest Minister Eshwar Khandre

The rise in green space is a positive development, but forest fires pose a growing threat to the region.
newTitle: Bengaluru Sees Slight Rise in Forest Cover, Ranks Among Greenest Cities in India

title: POEM-4 in PSLV-C60 / SpaDeX Mission - ISRO
Allu Arjun’s children moved to safety after home vandalised; Congress denies involvement in incident - The Indian Express
summary:
Allu Arjun’s Children Moved to Safety After Home Vandalised; Congress Denies Involvement

Publication Date: December 22, 2024 | Source: Indian Express

Hours after a group of people vandalised Telugu star Allu Arjun’s residence in Hyderabad, his children were moved to a secure location. The incident involved protesters demanding justice for a woman who died during a recent theatre stampede.

  • A group allegedly linked to the Osmania University Joint Action Committee vandalised parts of Arjun's home.
  • The children, Ayaan and Arha, were escorted to safety amidst the chaos.
  • The protests erupted following the death of a woman in a stampede at a Pushpa 2 premiere.
  • The Congress party has denied any involvement, dismissing allegations of their participation as baseless.
“None of them belong to Congress. If they find any Congress link, those workers will stand disqualified.” - Telangana Pradesh Congress Committee spokesperson

The police have detained six individuals in connection with the vandalism, and the case continues to develop.
newTitle: Allu Arjun’s Children Moved to Safety After Home Vandalised; Congress Denies Involvement

title: Protests in J&K over reservation policy, CM Omar Abdullah's son joins stir - Hindustan Times
summary:
Protests in J&K Over Reservation Policy, CM Omar Abdullah's Son Joins Stir

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: Hindustan Times

Several political leaders and hundreds of students have gathered outside the residence of Jammu and Kashmir chief minister Omar Abdullah to seek a review of the reservation policy, introduced by the administration earlier this year.

  • Chief Minister Omar Abdullah's son joined the protests alongside students and party members.
  • Opposition leaders have also expressed their dissent regarding the new reservation policy.
  • The Jammu and Kashmir government formed a panel to review the policy amid growing calls for its revision.
“We hope the govt that came to power with a huge mandate and with a promise that they will rationalise the reservation - we hope the NC govt fulfils their promises in a time-bound manner.” - Iltija Mufti

The growing unrest over the reservation policy highlights significant political and social tensions within Jammu and Kashmir, particularly concerning youth representation and equitable access to opportunities.
newTitle: Protests in J&K Over Reservation Policy, CM Omar Abdullah's Son Joins Stir

title: Alarming that Kerala's waste was dumped in Tamil Nadu: Kerala High Court - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Kerala High Court Condemns Waste Dumping in Tamil Nadu

Published on: 23 Dec 2024, 9:56 am

The Kerala High Court criticized the state government for inadequate waste management, highlighting illegal dumping of biomedical waste in Tamil Nadu.

  • The court described the situation as alarming and required a report by January 10, 2025.
  • The Cochin Corporation must address polluted drains and dumping prevention measures.
  • Details are required regarding waste disposal from hospitals and collection practices.
  • Six criminal cases have been filed with three arrests made.
  • Additionally, a food poisoning incident at an Anganwadi was flagged, with concerns over contaminated water used for food preparation.
"It is an alarming situation that waste generated in Kerala is being disposed in the neighbouring State, that too in a haphazard manner and contrary to the legal requirements." - Kerala High Court

The court's decisions stem from a broader investigation into waste management following a significant incident at the Brahmapuram garbage yard, pointing to systemic issues that require urgent attention.
newTitle: Kerala High Court Condemns Waste Dumping in Tamil Nadu

title: UPSC cheating case: Delhi HC refuses anticipatory bail to ex-IAS probationer Puja Khedkar - The Hindu
summary:
UPSC cheating case: Delhi HC refuses anticipatory bail to ex-IAS probationer Puja Khedkar

Published: December 23, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

The Delhi High Court has denied anticipatory bail to former IAS probationer Puja Khedkar, who is facing allegations of cheating in the civil services examination by falsely availing of reservation benefits.

  • The court ruled that a prima facie case against Khedkar justified the need for further investigation.
  • Justice Chandra Dhari Singh stated that the case represents fraud against a constitutional body.
  • Khedkar is accused of misrepresenting her application to secure undue advantages in the UPSC Civil Services Examination, 2022.
  • The Delhi Police registered an FIR under multiple legal provisions following the UPSC's actions against her.
"Anticipatory bail plea is dismissed. Interim protection from arrest is vacated." - Justice Chandra Dhari Singh

Despite her denials, the allegations against Khedkar involve significant fraud and misrepresentation in securing examination attempts.
newTitle: Delhi HC Denies Bail to Ex-IAS Trainee in Cheating Case

title: Jayant removes all RLD spokespersons after Dalit leader slams Amit Shah for Ambedkar remarks - ThePrint
summary:
Jayant removes all RLD spokespersons after Dalit leader slams Amit Shah for Ambedkar remarks

Date: Recent
Source: ThePrint

In a swift decision, Jayant Chaudhary, leader of the Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD), has removed all national and state spokespersons following remarks made by Dalit leader Kamal Gautam, who criticized Union Home Minister Amit Shah's comments about Ambedkar.

  • All RLD national and state spokespersons were dismissed for being either inactive or overly active.
  • The decision followed Gautam's call for Shah to apologize for his 'inappropriate' remarks on Ambedkar.
  • Shah asserted his statements were misrepresented and defended his remarks in the Rajya Sabha.
  • Gautam highlighted the lack of action against rising criminal incidents affecting Dalits and women.
  • The removal may indicate internal party tensions regarding public comments and coalition dynamics.
“Amit Shah’s statement on Babasaheb is not correct... This will reach all those who follow Babasaheb across the world.” - Kamal Gautam

This incident underscores the sensitivity surrounding Dalit issues within Indian politics and the reaction of political parties to internal dissent.
newTitle: Jayant removes all RLD spokespersons after Dalit leader slams Amit Shah for Ambedkar remarks

title: 'Bengaluru is what it is because of north Indians,' claims woman in viral video, sparks debate - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bengaluru Debate Ignited by Woman's Viral Claim on North Indians

Date: Dec 23, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A recent viral video featuring a Delhi woman discussing cultural biases in Bengaluru has sparked intense debate online. She claims that 'Bengaluru is Bengaluru because of North Indians' and criticizes locals for their perception of North Indians.

  • The woman's video addresses cultural shocks upon moving to Bengaluru.
  • She notes that North Indians are often referred to as 'these Hindi people' by locals.
  • The video has received over 600k views and significant online engagement.
  • Mixed reactions were observed on social media, with discussions on Bengaluru's cosmopolitan identity.
“I love this city, and I will definitely come back.”

The reactions highlight a divide in attitudes and portrayal of North Indians in Bengaluru, illustrating ongoing discussions about cultural integration and identity in India's metropolitan areas.
newTitle: Bengaluru Debate Ignited by Woman's Viral Claim on North Indians
